author: sky.cactus
content: As for your code, I'm not sure create2 returns the created address.  It may return nothing or a boolean.

author: amit0617
content: create2 does return address. It was created for the purposes of pre-computing address deterministically given a salt.

author: jochembrouwer
content:
CREATE2 + CREATE returns an address (this is put on stack once you've ran into CREATE[2] into EVM). If the contract creation failed, then 0 is put on stack.

(If this was not to case, one has to manually calculate the address which was created in the EVM)
